summary: This bill, the Health Care Fairness for All Act, aims to reform the US healthcare system. Key provisions include eliminating individual and employer mandates, providing states with more flexibility in coverage options (including promoting Health Savings Accounts), reforming Medicare (site-neutral payments, Medicare Advantage), and introducing a health insurance tax credit. The bill also addresses health savings account improvements and state flexibility in health insurance regulation, price transparency, and Medicaid payment reform. New provisions are detailed regarding the use of Roth HSAs for chronically ill enrollees, and telehealth flexibilities.
